title: Ragi Roti (Finger Millet Flatbread)
description: Nutritious and gluten-free flatbread made from finger millet flour, often served with vegetables or chutney.

instructions.description: In a bowl, combine ragi flour, salt, and optional ingredients (onion, cilantro, green chili, cumin seeds). Mix well.
Gradually add hot water to the flour mixture, mixing with a spoon initially (as it will be hot).
Once cool enough to handle, knead the mixture into a soft, smooth, non-sticky dough. Add a little more hot water if the dough feels too dry, or a little more ragi flour if it's too sticky.
Divide the dough into equal-sized balls.
Take one dough ball. Place it on a piece of parchment paper, banana leaf, or a lightly floured surface. You can also use a plastic sheet.
Wet your fingers slightly and gently pat the dough ball outwards into a thin, even circle (roti). Alternatively, place another sheet of parchment/plastic on top and roll gently with a rolling pin.
Heat a tawa or flat skillet over medium heat.
Carefully lift the roti (along with the parchment/plastic if used) and place it dough-side down onto the hot tawa. Peel off the parchment/plastic if used.
Cook for about a minute until small bubbles appear. Drizzle a little oil or ghee around the edges if desired.
Flip the roti and cook the other side for 1-2 minutes until cooked through and has light brown spots.
Press gently with a spatula while cooking.
Serve hot with yogurt, chutney, or your favorite vegetable side dish (sabzi).
